New Records: Quinton de Kock scored 65 runs from the top of the innings, a pivotal performance for South Africa
Key Match Events: Harry Brook scored 52 runs, but was caught by Aiden Markram in the final over
Liam Livingstone scored 33 runs, but was caught by Tristan Stubbs
Kagiso Rabada took 2-25 from his four overs, bowling nine dot balls in the process
Markram made a diving, backwards-running catch to dismiss Brook and swing the pendulum for the final time in the final over
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa's Aiden Markram said the pitch was slow and that they wanted to squeeze in the field
England's Jos Buttler said they were happy chasing 160 but South Africa bowled well in the powerplay
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa's Quinton de Kock said he just goes game by game and doesn't carry confidence from previous knocks
England's Jos Buttler said they were happy chasing 160 but couldn't quite get over the line
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was defined by stunning grabs, including Markram's diving, backwards-running catch to dismiss Brook
The required run rate was over 10 an over at one point in the chase
South Africa's bowlers struggled to find their yorker length, with several full tosses being hit for boundaries
